comments:
I20040226
I have a plugin.xml file with some form of error in it.  When I try to load it 
into my environment, I get the error message at the bottom of this comment.  
It is then up to me to remove bits of the xml code until I find the problem.  
This is very nasty if you have a large plugin.xml file (example - 
org.eclipse.jdt.ui).  Could you give me some hint as to where the offending 
xml is?  A line number would be great but even the name of the tag would help.

osgi> install reference:file:d:/EclipseEnvs/3.0/org.eclipse.newViews

Agreed that the reporting could be better.  Lets see what Rafael can do with 
this.

BTW, what does the PDE plugin.xml editor have to say about the error?  I assume 
it would point it out pretty clearly.  If not, there should be a bug there as 
well.

Note also that the runtime plugin.xml parser is now supposed to be lean mean 
and ultra keen.  No extra stuff to support development time.  That is what PDE 
is for.  They have their own parser that is able to add markers, ...  That is 
not an excuse for the lack of proper error text but rather sets the context for 
what kind of detail to expect.

So this was the output produced in the console by the install command. The
appropriate messages were probably logged, as I noticed when I reproduced it:

The parsing exception is omitted when shown in the console because it is too
deep to be seen. The parser logs the XML exception and throws it, the Plugin
Converter logs a PluginConversionException but does not throw it (it cannot, due
to bug 59803).

We should log if we can still do our work, or throw an exception, but not both.
